Plot partial dependency as line plot

Source: R/ebirdst-plotting.R
plot_pds.Rd

For all of the available predictors in a single species set of eBird Status and Trends products, this function makes a line plot of a single partial dependency, with two options for smoothing.

plot_pds(pd_name, pds, st_extent, plot_quantiles = FALSE,
  pointwise_pi = TRUE, stixel_pds = FALSE, k.cont.res = 25,
  gbm.n.trees = 500, nnn.bs = 100, equivalent.ensemble.ss = 10,
  ci.alpha = 0.05, mean.all.data = FALSE, ylim = NA,
  print_plot = TRUE)

Arguments

pd_name

character; Single predictor name from PDs (via load_pds()). Unique predictors can be listed by calling pds <- load_pds(path) and then calling unique(pds$V4).
pds

data.frame; From load_pds().
st_extent

list; st_extent list for spatiotemporal filtering. Required, as results are less meaningful over large spatiotemporal extents.
plot_quantiles

logical; Default is FALSE. Adds a band for the upper (90th) and lower (10th) quantiles of the individual stixel PD values.
pointwise_pi

logical; Default is TRUE. A pointwise smoothing of individual stixel PD values. Ideal visualization of the PD values.
stixel_pds

logical; Default is FALSE. Toggle to plot the individual stixel PD values as semi-transparent lines.
k.cont.res

int; Default is 25. Number of knots to use in GAM based on continuining resolution of the current eBird Status and Trends products.
gbm.n.trees

int; Default is 500. Number of trees to use in pointwise GAM.
nnn.bs

int; Default is 100.
equivalent.ensemble.ss

int; Default is 10.
ci.alpha

numeric; Default is 0.05. Alpha transparency of confidence intervals.
mean.all.data

logical; Default is FALSE.
ylim

vector pair; Opportunity to pre-define plot y-min and y-max as vector pair (e.g., c(-1, 1)).
print_plot

logical; Default is TRUE. Set to FALSE to turn off plotting and only get return of pointwise pi values.

Value

Plots barplot and returns a list containing the quantiles (if plot_quantiles = TRUE) and/or the pointwise_pis upper, lower, and median (if pointwise_pi = TRUE).

Examples

# NOT RUN {
# download and load example data
dl_path <- tempdir()
sp_path <- download_data("example_data", path = dl_path)
pds <- load_pds(sp_path)

# define a spatioremporal extent
ne_extent <- list(type = "rectangle",
                  lat.min = 40,
                  lat.max = 47,
                  lon.min = -80,
                  lon.max = -70,
                  t.min = 0.425,
                  t.max = 0.475)

plot_pds(pd_name = "TIME", pds = pds, st_extent = ne_extent)

# }
